authors: Ajnabi, J., Dam, B., Gupta, E., Saha, T., Dutta, A., Kumar, S., Gupta, A., Palakodeti, D., Jamora, C.
title: Actin-dependent mechanotransduction controls nucleocytoplasmic partitioning of DNMT3a through ERK1/2 signaling during cutaneous wound healing
details: This study demonstrates how wound-induced mechanical cues regulate DNMT3a nucleocytoplasmic localization through actin remodeling and ERK1/2 signaling, revealing a mechanotransduction-driven epigenetic control mechanism during cutaneous wound healing.

authors: Dam, B., Ajnabi, J., Saha, T., Shrivastava, A., Badarinathan, K., Hegde, A., Dutta, A., Jasoria, S., Kataria, S., Singh, A., et al.
title: Mindin mediated αM-Integrin endocytosis activates STAT3 to maintain keratinocyte stemness
details: This work uncovers a Mindin–integrin–STAT3 signaling axis that sustains keratinocyte stemness through integrin endocytosis and downstream transcriptional activation.

authors: Dutta, S., Islam, Z., Das, S., Barman, A., Chowdhury, M., Mondal, B. P., Ajnabi, J., Manna, D.
title: Harmonizing plant resilience: unveiling the symphony of membrane lipid dynamics in response to abiotic stresses
details: A comprehensive review of membrane lipid remodeling in plants under abiotic stress, highlighting lipid-mediated signaling mechanisms that contribute to stress tolerance.

authors: Bhatt, T., Dam, B., Khedkar, S. U., Lall, S., Pandey, S., Kataria, S., Ajnabi, J., Gulzar, S.-E.-J., Dias, P. M., Waskar, M., et al.
title: Niacinamide enhances cathelicidin mediated SARS-CoV-2 membrane disruption
details: This study shows that niacinamide potentiates cathelicidin-mediated antiviral activity by enhancing membrane disruption of SARS-CoV-2, providing mechanistic insight into host defense enhancement.

authors: Rana, I., Kataria, S., Tan, T. L., Hajam, E. Y., Kashyap, D. K., Saha, D., Ajnabi, J., Paul, S., Jayappa, S., Ananthan, A. S. H. P., et al.
title: Mindin (SPON2) is essential for cutaneous fibrogenesis in a mouse model of systemic sclerosis
details: This paper establishes Mindin as a critical regulator of dermal fibrogenesis, demonstrating its requirement for extracellular matrix remodeling in systemic sclerosis.

authors: Badarinath, K., Dam, B., Kataria, S., Zirmire, R. K., Dey, R., Kansagara, G., Ajnabi, J., Hegde, A., Singh, R., Masudi, T., et al.
title: Snail maintains the stem/progenitor state of skin epithelial cells and carcinomas through the autocrine effect of matricellular protein Mindin
details: This study identifies an autocrine Snail–Mindin signaling loop that sustains epithelial stemness in both normal skin and carcinoma contexts.

authors: Rana, I., Kataria, S., Tan, T. L., Hajam, E. Y., Kashyap, D. K., Saha, D., Ajnabi, J., Paul, S., Jayappa, S., Ananthan, A. S. H. P., et al.
title: Mindin is essential for cutaneous fibrogenesis in a new mouse model of systemic sclerosis
details: An initial preprint report describing the role of Mindin in regulating dermal fibrosis using a newly developed mouse model of systemic sclerosis.

title: Identification of cis-regulatory regions regulating the expression of PM19 gene in wheat
journal: MSc Thesis, ICAR – Indian Agricultural Research Institute
details: Master’s thesis identifying cis-regulatory elements controlling PM19 gene expression in wheat, contributing to understanding of stress-responsive transcriptional regulation in plants.
